Intro.Explanation: The introduction sets the stage for the song, with a shout-out to New York City in a colloquial manner.

Lyrics.Spanish:
Si te quieres divertir
Con encanto y con primor
Solo tienes que vivir (¿Pa' dónde?)
Un verano en Nueva York (¡Nueva York!)
Lyrics.English:
If you want to have fun
With charm and delight
You just have to live (Where to?)
A summer in New York (New York!)

Chorus.Explanation: The chorus describes the enchanting and exciting experience of spending a summer in New York. Bad Bunny's playful interruptions add humor and highlight the city's unpredictable nature.

Lines.Spanish:
Ey, ey, ey, 4 de julio, 4th de July
Ando con mi primo, borracho, rulay
Los mío' en El Bronx saben la que hay
Con la nota en high por Washington Heights
Lines.English:
Hey, hey, hey, 4th of July, 4th of July
I'm hanging with my cousin, drunk, chill
My people in The Bronx know what's up
With the vibe high in Washington Heights

Lines.Explanation: Bad Bunny sets the scene of celebrating the 4th of July in New York, highlighting the festive and relaxed atmosphere in Latino neighborhoods like The Bronx and Washington Heights.

Lines.Spanish:
Willie Colón, me dicen 'el malo', ey
Porque pasan los año' y sigo dando palo'
Vendiendo disco' como cuadro' 'e Frida Kahlo
Lines.English:
Willie Colón, they call me 'the bad one,' hey
Because the years go by and I keep making hits
Selling records like Frida Kahlo's paintings

Lines.Explanation: Referencing Willie Colón and Frida Kahlo, Bad Bunny highlights his continued success and cultural impact in music.

Lines.Spanish:
El perico es blanco, sí, sí, el tusi rosita, eh, eh
No te confunda', no, no, mejor evita, ey (Ey)
Lines.English:
The coke is white, yes, yes, the tusi is pink, eh, eh
Don’t get confused, no, no, better avoid it, hey (Hey)

Lines.Explanation: References to drugs suggest a gritty aspect of nightlife, with a warning to avoid confusion and trouble.

Interlude.Spanish:
The best in the world
Number one, the best in the world, ¿okey? ¡Puerto Rico!
Interlude.English:
The best in the world
Number one, the best in the world, okay? Puerto Rico!
Interlude.Explanation: Bad Bunny asserts his global success, highlighting his pride in representing Puerto Rico.

Lines.Spanish:
¿Cómo Bad Bunny va a ser rey del pop, ey
Con reggaetón y dembow?
Lines.English:
How is Bad Bunny going to be king of pop, hey
With reggaetón and dembow?

Lines.Explanation: Bad Bunny challenges traditional music boundaries, embracing his role in mainstream pop while rooted in reggaetón and dembow.

Lines.Spanish:
Con silenciador les robamo' las gata', James Bond, ey
Yo estoy en la mía, no tengo adversario, no
Lines.English:
With silencers we steal their girls, James Bond, hey
I’m in my zone, I have no adversary, no

Lines.Explanation: Using the imagery of James Bond, he conveys stealth and charm, emphasizing his self-assured position in the music industry.

Second Chorus.Explanation: The chorus revisits the vibrant summer theme, with Bad Bunny humorously suggesting the fleeting nature of the moment.

Interlude 2.Spanish: Shh, cuida'o, que nadie nos escuche
Interlude 2.English: Shh, careful, so no one hears us
Interlude 2.Explanation: Introducing an element of secrecy or exclusivity, this adds intrigue to the song.

Lines.Spanish:
Tú tiene' piquete, mami, yo también
Tú estás buena, yo estoy bueno también
Huelo rico y ando con los de cien
Si tú lo quiere', lo tiene' que mover
Lines.English:
You’ve got swagger, baby, so do I
You look good, I look good too
I smell nice and roll with hundred-dollar bills
If you want it, you’ve got to move it

Lines.Explanation: Bad Bunny talks about mutual attraction and confidence, along with a call to dance and engage actively with the vibe.

Outro.Explanation: The outro repeats the call to 'move,' emphasizing a rhythmic and energetic conclusion to the song.
